DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date on which a methylated-DNA-protein-cysteine methyltransferase (MGMT) test was done.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Methylated-DNA-protein-cysteine methyltransferase (207 aa, ~22 kDa) is encoded by the human MGMT gene. This protein is involved in both repair and dealkylation of DNA._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: enzyme that transfers methyl groups from O(6) methylguanine and other methylated moities of DNA, to a cysteine residue in itself, thus repairing alkylated DNA in a single step reaction:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: Methylated-DNA-protein-cysteine methyltransferase (207 aa, ~22 kDa) is encoded by the human MGMT gene. This protein is involved in both repair and dealkylation of DNA.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for 1601 study in Rave as requested by J.Zhao. mc 2/27/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Date as required for Clinical Trials Monitoring Service submissions.  Exchange format is YYYYMMDD.  Display format is DDMMMYYYY, with the month display the first three letters of each month (Jan, Feb, Mar, etc.).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk Transferred context, added CSI and reg status, released per Round 5 finalization task. --- Display and exchange formats are based on CTMS reporting requirements v.3.02 and all subsequent versions of these guidelines.
